intro: Sidastrum multiflorum, commonly known as the many-flowered sidastrum, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Sidastrum multiflorum thrives in well-drained soil and requires ample sunlight to flourish.
